ygData.subject: Re: Invisibility
ygData.msgSnippet: Invisibility by nature is unreliable.  If you are invisible, still keep away from any harmful creature.  Instead, when you want to have a minimal chance that
ygData.messageBody:
Invisibility by nature is unreliable. If you are invisible, still keep away
from any harmful creature. Instead, when you want to have a minimal chance
that you will be killed, cast it and hope.

I use invisibility to travel through Highpass Hold, and across East Karana
when I don't want to encounter some of the nasties in there.

As to duration, it can last from a few seconds to several minutes. I have
had it last over 20 minutes, and it usually lasts from about 5 minutes to 10
minutes. If a creature spots you and is unfriendly, then invis will not
stop it from hitting you. Once spotted, and on that creatures hate list,
neither invis nor minor illusion will stop you from being attacked.

Still, all in all it is a useful spell. If you must travel in hated lands,
by all means use it.

Hope this helps,
Loreweaver of the Eldritch Collective
-----Original Message-----
From: DeGirolami, Franck <degirolami@...>
To: Eqenchanters (E-mail) <eqenchanters@onelist.com>
Date: Tuesday, April 20, 1999 5:51 PM
Subject: [eqenchanters] Invisibility


>From: "DeGirolami, Franck" <degirolami@...>
>
>I gave up a level 16 dark-elf necro because their invisibility spell (
>gather shadows ) was very unreliable. One sad evening, coming back from a
>very long quest that brought me to Kerra Island and South Karana, I got
>hacked multiple times in Riverdale losing about 4 bubs of xp because my
>invis wore off on me randomly. I got really pissed off that at level 16, I
>could not manage to cast a level 8 spell reliably and decided to start
>another character more appropriate for travelling since I was very much
into
>research and quests.
>With my enchantress, I got invisibility at level 4 and used it some times.
>It always seemed to work great but I might be wrong. Yesterday, I found out
>that this invisibility spell is as bad as gather shadows as a %$#%^^%$
>griffin nuked me a few seconds after I cast invisibility. Since then, I've
>noticed the same kind on unreliability...but only since I made level 8...I
>might be wrong.
>Anyway, I would like to know how's the enchanter's invisibility like at
>level 16 or 20 or more. CAN YOU COUNT ON IT?
>Thanks,
>Skara, the pissed-off dark-elf Necro from Fennin-Ro
>now known as Skara, the enchantress from Innoruuk
>
